page.title: 07TERLING PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: This Church of England (Aided) School, was built by the 2nd Lord Rayleigh in 1853 and is still owned and maintained by the present Lord Rayleigh. Catering originally for over 100 children of all ages in 4 classes, housed in 2 large classrooms, which form the old part of the school. It was extended in 1965 with the addition of 2 new classrooms, a kitchen and a hall. It now has only 3 classes and caters for 71 children between 5 and 11 yrs. Staff comprises of a teaching Head plus 2 full time teachers, a part_time and a peripatetic Remedial teacher, also a secretary, 2 cleaners, 2 cooks and 2 mid_day assistants, with extra help from parents with Reading, Craft, Gymnastics, Computer, Cooking and transport. The P.T.A. organises fund raising and social activities and the School partakes in area sports rallies
